snippet: Researchers found that older African-Americans with Alzheimer’s were slightly more likely to have one gene, ABCA7, that is thought to confer risk for the disease.
abstract: Study published in Journal of American Medical Assn finds that African-Americans have slightly higher risk of Alzheimer's disease than people of largely European ancestry, but observes no major genetic difference to account for disparity; is one of only large studies ever done on Alzheimer's in African-Americans.
lead_paragraph: Researchers found that older African-Americans with Alzheimer’s were slightly more likely to have one gene, ABCA7, that is thought to confer risk for the disease.

headline.seo: Alzheimer’s Study Finds Same Variant Genes in Blacks
headline.main: In Blacks, Alzheimer’s Study Finds Same Variant Genes as in Whites
headline.print_headline: In Blacks, Alzheimer’s Study Finds Same Variant Genes as in Whites

keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
keywords.name: organizations
